dialogues.text: Whiskey, rocks thanks. The bartender slings one over and walks away. GREY (CONT’D) Cheers. He takes a swig. It’s good. Strong.  57.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ask him if he knows Serk Brantner. Grey mumbles into his chest, keeping his voice down.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You don’t know shit about people. A guy like that doesn’t exactly respond well to strangers asking questions. Let me handle this. He slugs the rest of the drink down. GREY (CONT’D) (to the bartender) Another one thanks champ. (beat) You know, I thought I’d seen the last of the great bars like this. The bartender smiles. INT. CORTEZ’ CAR - MOVING - NIGHT Cortez steers wildly, a uniformed officer next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eron is hunched at his desk. Staring into space. A voice tones throughout the room.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There is a police officer here to see you, sir. Before Eron can react, Cortez storms in.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: You have absolutely zero authority to walk into this --

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: You put something inside Grey, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me, Eron. He’s not just up and walking, he’s disarming cops like a Navy Seal.  58.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: Tell me your theory. I’1l be sure to act appropriately impressed by your powers of deduction.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: He was here today. I know that, Eron. No one can do what he did without a computer’s help. If there’s something inside him, then you can track him. I want to know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: Detective --

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: We're going to find him. And if we do and he tells us something different than you, I’m taking you to jail. Where is he? Eron looks like a rabbit in the headlights. He peers over Cortez’ shoulder at a CAMERA pointed down at him. Watchin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender leans over the bar, chatting and laughing w Grey. Shot glasses are lined up in front of Grey.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I swear, they left my buddy on the sidewalk! He picked the wrong damn bar to have an issue with.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you gotta be careful of country joints. They’re friendly, but if you push ‘em...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: It’s actually no accident that I found your gem of an establishment. A man I served with used to drink here. Serk. Serk Brantner.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Knew him well. One of my regulars. A lot of service guys come here.  59.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not sure if you know this but I’ve got some unfortunate news. He died.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I watch the news. He was murdered. Tell you the truth, I thought Serk was indestructible. Got himself shot up on a tour and walked right out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: He was a tough bastard.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: He better be with all that shit inside him.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What shit?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: All that metal. Computers and what not.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why did they do that to him?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: He volunteered for it. He was in security. Said it made him a better soldier. The bartender steps away. bathroom. Grey gets up and heads for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A filthy commode, fitting red light-bulb washes the Grey shoves into a toilet the syringe into the vial for the establishment it serves. A grime and graffiti in a blood tint. stall, closing the door. He stabs the dealer gave him.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, Grey. These narcotics are highly dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Jesus, you sound like a cop. I’ve got a freaking cop living inside my head.  60.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It does not make sense to me that humans deliberately malfunction.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Of course it doesn’t to you. You’re a machine. Your memory is filled with one’s and zero’s - our memory is filled with every fuck up and mistake we've ever made. You can erase your memory with the click of a button. Ours can only be dulled one night at a time.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If you have a problem, calculate a solution. A temporary distraction does nothing to solve the problem. Grey loads the needle and poises it at his forearm. His a does not move.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: If you don’t let me do this, I’m gonna scream my ass off and make a big scene and fuck this all up. Do you want that?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are not thinking clearly.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are addicted.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No. I’m not. Do it now! Grey stabs the needle into his arm. The plunger depresses CLOSE ON GREY’S EYE - the pupil dilates with a sudden rus Grey's breathing slows. FROM HIS POV - his vision BLURS, light bulb blossoming into an amorphous shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey staggers out of the bathroom, woozy. FROM GREY’S POV the rooms shifts shapes, swelling and deflating. Breathin Grey walks forward but it’s a wayward, loping step. As th pushing through mud.  61. Stem’s voice has slowed to a dead battery drawl.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Grey....you...have...compromised... us... The bartender watches Grey, puzzled. Grey takes his seat the bar.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your...brain...is giving me... strange signals. Grey cracks up laughing.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: That’s the point.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Point of what? A phone bleats and the bartender steps away. He listens, turns back to Grey, confused. BARTENDER (CONT’D) It’s for you. He hands the phone to Grey - an old fashioned landline.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ERON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (from phone) Having fun? Because they’re probably surrounding that place right about now, I’d say.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Who is?

dialogues.speaker: ERON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (from phone) You can put a computer into a mechanic but you can’t take the moron out. If you want to go off the grid so you can’t be tracked, go to an apartment building at Seventh and Spring. Apartment two twelve. Ask for Jonah. It’1ll be expensive, but right now your flesh is worth about ninety million dollars, so maybe you could give him a few pounds of it.  62. Eron hangs up. Grey drops the phone, woozy on his feet, t scrambles to the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two police cruisers pull up. Six officers, including Cort and Brennan, pile out. Cortez is gripping Eron’s tablet computer screen. A circle representing Grey pulses on the

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: You take the back, Brennan. Do not shoot him. I want a clean arrest. Brennan and another officer head for the back alley. Cort and the other officers stride in formation towards the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey staggers to the sink, glaring into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I...told...you...not...to do it. He wraps his hand in a huge bundle of paper towels and sm it against the window, shattering it. He clears the glass, leveraging up onto the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey plummets down onto a pile of trash, landing clumsily is in no condition to fight. He turns and heads for the mouth of the alley. Brennan ro the corner, gun out in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Freeze! Hold it! Do not move. Grey doesn’t respond. Too stoned.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I...will...have to...save...you.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Put your hands behind your head and get down on your knees! Grey lowers his head, out cold. Though his eyes are close he stays on his feet and his hands rise into the air.  63.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Down on your knees, now! Grey complies. The other officer charges in behind Grey, shoving him onto his stomach. The second officer drops a knee onto Grey’s back, unhooki his handcuffs. As he moves to clamp them on Grey’s wrists there is a sudden EXPLOSION of action. Grey SEIZES the cop’s wrist, rolling over and SMACKING HI the face, then whipping out his gun and firing one clean into the cops gut. As he does all this, his EYES ARE CLOS Grey spins as Brennan points his gun. Using the second of as a shield, he rises to one knee and aims at Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Brennan is struck, crumples instantly. The sound startles Grey. His eyes flutter open, regaining consciousness. He blinks and looks around. There are two dead cops layin the dirty concrete around him.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (groggy ) What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were...trying...to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You shot two cops...

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No Grey...I saved your life. Grey staggers to his feet. He jams his fingers down his throat, vomiting into a trash can, then runs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Bhatia is hunched over his desk, doing the bulk of hi work: filling out reports. A man strolls into the room. It is the WIRY MAN. From now we will call him FISK. He is all southern drawl and charm chewing on gum.  64.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me sir, are you lookin’ after the body of the man who was killed in Boyle Heights yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: DR. BHATIA
dialogues.text: That’s a criminal case under active investigation. Are you a friend or relative?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Yeah. A friend. I can tell you who the victim is...and a lot more about him. If you so desire. Fisk takes a seat in front of Bhatia’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BHATIA
dialogues.text: Then the detectives involved will be very interested to hear from you. Let me call them down here. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: People call me Fisk. Dr. Bhatia reaches for the phone. As he does, Fisk SNEEZE

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me. He covers his mouth with a handkerchief. We ZOOM IN to a MICROSCOPIC LEVEL, exploring the tiny particles Fisk ejec with his sneeze. We get CLOSER still, seeing that the microbes are in fact MECHANICAL - nanobots invisible to the human eye. The nanobots gather into a cloud, flocking like birds, mo through the atmosphere as Dr. Bhatia breathes in. We are now so close that the nanobots look like space stations. Cutting devices detach from their sides as they sucked into Dr. Bhatia’s nostrils. OUTSIDE MICROSCOPIC VIEW - Dr. Bhatia holds the phone aga his ear. He twitches, screwing up his nose as if he inhal an irritant. He clears his throat, dialing the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BHATIA
dialogues.text: Give me one second.  65. He twitches again, then scratches his throat. The pain gr and he drops the phone, suddenly consumed by agony. He clutches his temples as if he were having a stroke. Fisk watches, smiling. Bhatia lets out a croak, spittle flying from his mouth. A drop of blood dribbles out of his nose and he arcs onto t floor. His legs spasm.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: I'll bet you didn’t think your life was gonna end today when you woke up this morning. Fisk waits until he stops kicking, then casually plucks o his gum and plants it on a framed photo of Dr. Bhatia wit his two young daughters. He wanders over to the corpse of cohort, now covered by a sheet. He wrenches the sheet back, then breathes forcefully onto body. We close in again, seeing that the corpse is being eaten microscopic bacteria at an extremely accelerated rate - t flesh disappearing, bone, muscle, metal, everything. Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentrification has not kicked in here. A decrepit buildin A lone figure emerges from the shadows, moving across the street. It is Grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey hustles down the corridor, head down. Stops at 212. He knocks loudly.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: My name is Grey. I was wondering if Jonah was there?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, there’s no one here by that name.  66.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That voice isn’t real.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Eron sent me. I need help with a computer.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, please go away sir. Grey retrieves a thick wad of cash from his jacket, holds up to the peep hole.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I have cash. Several locks snap open behind the door and it opens a fraction. A young man peers out. GREY (CONT’D) What I don’t have is time. The door opens. The man is skinny, dressed like a street All in black. The Guy With The Dragon Tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Hold it there. A droning sound emits from a small device the man is hold

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: I’m scanning you for weapons. The device squawks. Grey takes out his gun and hands it o

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Where’s your girlfriend? The young man points the device at a speaker built into t wall. The voice Grey heard lilts out of it.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (from speaker) Who is it?  67.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Most reliable girlfriend I’ve ever had. The young man leads Grey into a large, concrete loft spac Nests of wiring dangle from the ceiling. Activist propaga and street art is displayed across the walls, stacks of computer equipment piled in the corner. YOUNG MAN (CONT’D) So what do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I have a computer that the police are interested in. They can track it. I want to make it disappear.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s laughably easy. Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: In my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several officers crowd around Brennan. He is strapped to gurney and loaded into an ambulance, groaning. Alive. Cortez glances down at the tablet computer, sees the puls dot of Grey.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: He’s at the corner of Seventh and Spring. Let’s go. Three man teams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey sits on a bench as the young man boots up his comput Wires connect an electrode to the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: So, Jonah --

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: That’s not my name. I don’t have a name. Not one you can pronounce. He snatches up a spray can, shaking it up and spraying an anarchists A on the wall, with an arrow pointing out of i  68. b> It means anarchy with a point. See, too many figures in the hacker movement are just about wanton destruction, but you’ve gotta have a purpose, otherwise you’re just proving them right when they say we're mindless, purposeless terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Genius. b> You better lie down. If it’s controlling your body, you won’t be able to move while I’m doing this. He pecks at his computer.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Now excuse me for a minute while I break into your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rotting lobby of the building is split with light as door is opened. Fisk enters, trailed by another of the assailants from th night Grey was shot. His name is WEN (28). Fisk holds up tablet similar to the one Cortez has. A little junkier, n as slick. On it, he can see Grey pulsing as a small red d They head to the elevator. Out of order. They march up th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez screeches to a halt in her car, alighting with two other cops. They glare up at the decrepit apartment build Cortez glances down at the satellite tracking tablet.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: We follow this until we’re right on top of him, as close as this will get us. It looks like he’s pretty high up. Use caution, he’s armed. Seven police officers bolt across the street.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey is lying on the bench. He cannot move - Stem has bee disabled.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: How much longer do you think it’1l take? b> A lot quicker than anyone else could do it for this price.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You make a lot of money doing this? b> Not really. I have a real job. I do occasional system building work for multinational parasites so that I can take home a pay check and then dismantle that very system from underneath my cloak of legitimacy.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Your cloak? b> It’s a metaphor. I don’t actually have a cloak. (beat) I used to have one. In my vampire phase. Stupid ex-girlfriend got me into it. He peels back his lip to reveal two pointy teeth.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: I still have the teeth though. Pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk and Wen huff up the stairs. Calm. Methodical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rivers of code cascade down A>’s monitor. He types furiou then pecks a final key.  70. b> You are officially more dangerous than cancer. I built a firewall around you so that you cannot be tracked and stripped away all in- built restrictions on your system. In other words, nobody can hack you but you can hack everybody.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: When can I move again? b> When your system’s rebooted. Could take a few minutes. A> looks up at a bank of security monitors. On one of the the soft image of COPS ascending the stairs. A> stands. He claws up as many drives as he can into a backpack.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No...don’t leave me like this. b> There’s nothing I can do until you're back online. A> rushes to a hidden panel in the wall. He types in a co on a keypad and it whirs open. Everything has been pre- planned, including his eventual capture. He offers Grey a final glance, leaving the gun on the counter as a gift.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. We can’t let them win. He ducks through the exit door, letting it slide shut. On the monitors, we can see the two men sprinting up the stairs. Getting closer. Grey is as slack as a puppet. Helpless.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Come on. Wake up! Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cordon of police stampede up the stairs, Cortez at th head of the pack.  71. She holds the tracking tablet out in front of her. The re dot representing Grey suddenly disappears.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: He’s gone. I lost him! Eleventh or twelfth floor, go door to door! The cops charge onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk and Wen enter the twelfth floor corridor. They dash towards the apartment door for 212.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey glares at his finger.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Please Stem.... His finger twitches. The figures on the monitor are close now.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s nice to hear you say that. His arm moves. He uses it to push himself off the table, WALLOPING down onto the floor. He doesn’t feel it. His other arm comes to life, his legs dragging behind him wrenches his body along the floor. ON THE SECURITY MONITOR - Fisk and Wen stand outside A>’s door. They kick out, their boots smashing into the wood. Grey hauls his prone legs behind him, hand after hand, squirming across the floor to the WINDOW. The door JOLTS as Fisk kicks it. Grey elbow-stomps his way up to the window frame, forcing open and pouring his body through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey lands hard on the rusted metal frame of an old-fashi fire-escape stairway.  72. He is twelve stories up, closer to the roof than the grou

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Up. He grips the iron ladder, heaving his body upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door EXPLODES OPEN as Fisk kicks through it. He and W storm inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez and her team go from door to door on the twelfth floor, pounding on each one.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Police, open up! Frightened citizens open their doors, letting the cops sw their cramped apartments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey grits his teeth and hauls himself up out of view - - just as Fisk and Wen storm into the loft. Grey trembles holding himself up, his legs dangling below him.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hold on. Twelve stories up, Grey is facing the real life version o the simulation he experienced earlier. Sweat runs down hi arms. INSIDE THE APARTMENT - Fisk and Wen scan. OUTSIDE - Grey clambers a few rungs up, hauling himself o of view. Fisk sticks his head out. No one is there. A bead of sweat drops down onto the fire escape below Gre Fisk retreats inside -- -- just as the rusted metal Grey is hanging from gives a little. Grey cries out - a YELP of fright. Fisk whips his head back out the window, spotting Grey.  73.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: He’s here! Grey's legs FLAIL, coming back to life just as Fisk FIRES Bullets ping off the metal fire escape. With surprising agility, Grey vaults from one level to th next, closing in on the roof. Fisk and Wen leap through the window below him, giving ch mimicking his ascent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez and her team reach apartment 212, see the splinter door.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: In here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez charges into the apartment, wheeling around on eac corner. She spots the open window, peering through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey scrambles for cover behind an air-conditioning turre He takes out Cortez’ gun, cocking it.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Run now.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Run where?!

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The window. Grey glares up at the glass dermis of a building directly opposite the hotel. Only a few windows are still lit, sti burning the midnight oil.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I can’t get through that! I can’t run fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can do whatever I tell your limbs to do. You're faster now. Stronger.  74. As the pursuers close in, Grey launches into a run. His p picks up as he races across the roof. As he approaches th edge, he slows down, his legs jerking. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're resisting me. You have to let me take control. If you fight against me, my system cannot operate cleanly. Not without the full cooperation of your brain. Grey turns to spot his attackers gaining.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Okay. Do it. Grey starts running again, offering no resistance to Stem His legs gain speed, churning with amazing ferocity. He raises the gun, firing shots into a lit glass window opposite him. He bounds off the roof, screaming -- -- SLAMMING INTO the bullet riddled window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey cannons through the window in a hail of glass, curle into a ball, landing on his side and rolling up as if he an expert gymnast. Without stopping, he keeps running through the open-plan office, weaving between a honeycomb of desks. He is movin like a super-human. His two pursuers leap through the window after him. Wen barely makes it, thudding onto the floor clumsily. Fisk misses, grasping onto the window ledge, shards of br glass cutting into his hands. He cries out in agony, haul himself up. Wen barrels after Grey, who is still running at a stunnin clip, his legs a blur of motion. He RAMS into a doorway, thumping it open and spilling int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- fire stairwell.  75. With precise dexterity, Grey lobs from level to level, heading downwards. Wen plunges after him, struggling to keep track of him. Grey stops three levels down, stampeding through the entr door in front of him and into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- another white collar purgatory. Desks and computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two security men lazing in front of a bank of monitors suddenly snap to attention as they spot figures on their monitors bolting through the empty offices above them. They draw their guns and head for the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk scrambles off the window ledge. His hands are bloody He glares down at the floor. FROM HIS POV, we make out th crimson THERMAL IMAGE of Grey darting through the office three floors below. He aims his right arm and fires at Grey. The shot misfire and he screams in pain, gripping his bloody hand, extract a blade of glass from the opening in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey scorches over desks, his breath heaving. Wen shoulders the door open behind Grey. He starts to run then turns when he spots the elevator. The numbers are ascending. He looks downwards. THROUGH HIS POV, we capture the therm image of the two security guards rising in the elevator several stories below. He lifts his leg, as if preparing for a karate kick, aimi his right foot at the floor. In the bottom of his combat there is a hole. Wen jerks his leg and a muzzle flash licks out of his boo THERE IS A GUN IMPLANTED IN HIS LEG.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guards inside are BLASTED backwards as powerful s EXPLODE through the elevator walls, shredding the metal l paper, nailing them both with deadly accuracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey barrels through the door, surging down the stairs. W charges in after him, firing shots down at him. Grey hip-checks a fire door open, ramming through into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another office, this one empty. No desks. No anything.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Turn and fight. There is nowhere left to run. Grey crouches beside the doorway. Wen creeps through the frame, not expecting a surprise attack. Grey claws his right wrist, hurling him downwards. They BODYSLAM into the wall, cracking the plaster. They engage a shoving match, brute force against desperate victim. Grey manages to pin Wen down, his arm against Wen’s throa

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Who are you? Wen laughs. Grey smashes his head into the wall. He loose his grip for one moment. As he does, Wen frees a knife fr his jacket, raising it up. GREY (CONT’D) Knife!

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Block it with your arm. I’1l turn the nerves off.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Remember to trust me.  77. Once again, there is a strong juxtaposition between Grey’ panicked shouts and Stem’s calm pronouncements. Wen drives the knife down. Grey holds up his arm. The bla spears through Grey’s tendons below the elbow. He grits h teeth in agony, then stares at it. Stem was right. He cannot feel it. Wen glares at him, shocked for a second. Grey uses the sp second to grapple him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why did you do it? Why did you kill her? Grey crushes the man’s skull with a vice-like grip.

dialogues.speaker: WEN
dialogues.text: It was a job. Like any other job. Grey’s face melts in shock.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Who were you working for? Who hired you?

dialogues.speaker: WEN
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Wen uses Grey’s shock to attack, driving a fist into Grey face and then bucking to his knees. He raises his right l driving it out with power and kicking Grey in the chest. Grey CATCHES his foot, Wen’s boot aiming right into his chest. Wen smiles and snaps his knee. We hear the sound o gun cocking.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (more firm than usual) Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like this. And with that, Grey steps to the side and then hammer blo Wen’s knee with his fist -- -- SNAPPING IT CLEAN in half, bending Wen’s leg back so t his foot is in front of his own face.  78. With a second lightning-fast move, Grey twists Wen’s ankl violently and the gun in his leg goes off - a crack of gunfire obliterating Wen’s face. Grey wrenches the knife free without flinching.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The leg.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Take his right leg.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No. I can’t...cut off someone’s leg.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I will do it. You can look away. Grey glares at the corpse, the blood pooling. He squats n to Wen’s leg, gripping the knife. He closes his eyes and turns his head. We hear the knife into flesh and sinew and bone. We do not see it. Grey struggles to hold back bile. Droplets of blood spatt his face as he saws away at the tendons. There is a satisfying thunk as the leg is severed.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now you can leave. Grey does just that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanked by uniformed officers, Cortez peers across from t roof to the shattered window in the building opposite.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Let’s get a team over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez hunches over Wen’s corpse, poking at the separatio wound of his leg at the upper thigh. CoP #1 Why would he cut the guys leg off?  79. Cortez leans in. Coiled around the muscle at the amputati point are a cluster of ELECTRONIC WIRES. She picks at the

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: To find out who built it. The cop does not understand. Cortez stands up. She looks at the tracking tablet, displaying a grid map of the city There is no sign of Grey on the screen. Cortez tosses the tablet aside, glaring out through the g window at the twinkling lights of the unfolding city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ribbons of pale red sunlight streak across the sky. Grey marches down the street, no longer nervous about bei tracked. He looks tired, his eyes ringed with circles.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up. I need to get off the street. Grey heads for one of the self-driving cars parked at the curb. His eyes strobe with a quick flash of light.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unlocking. The car chirps twice as if being unlocked, and the door o automatically. Grey sags into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey's eyes close, desperately tired.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need to dissect the leg.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I need to sleep first.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We cannot stop now. We have to keep going. Once we have another name, we can find the rest of them. From them, we can gain the information about who employed them to murder your wife. Don’t you want that?  80.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I want sleep.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sleeping will cost us time we don’t have. It puzzles me that humans do not take the path of least resistance.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You're not in charge, I am. I can’t function if I don’t sleep. I’m not a computer.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That much is certain.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: We’re not going anywhere. That’s an order. I’m sleeping. I’m going to sleep. Say yes if you understand.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Grey collapses into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey is passed out, dead to the world. The seat has been lowered all the way back and he is draped across it. Grey's eyes twitch and he jerks awake from his slumber. H scans around, afraid, suddenly adrenaline rich. Only his moves. He attempts to sit up but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Stem? He rolls his head. He is a quadriplegic once again. GREY (CONT’D) Stem, what the hell? Nothing. Grey shakes his head spastically. Panicked.

dialogues.speaker: STEM
dialogues.text: A long beat passes...then a calm voice.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m here, Grey.  81.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m not doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why can’t I move?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Because I’m not doing anything. Grey glares at his fingers, willing them to move. They twitch, raising slightly, but are unable to get much high

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are still a quadriplegic. Your spinal cord is still severed. I am the one moving your limbs. If I cease to work, you cease to move.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: So what...you’re on strike now?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am puzzled as to why you keep resisting me. It has made it difficult for me to operate.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I needed to sleep, that’s all. I’m the one in control of my own body. They’re my arms and legs, and you are a thing that helps move them.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, Grey. I am not an inanimate tool that helps you to function. I am a part of you. I am half of you.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No. You're not. That’s not how this works.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is now. When fill your veins with illegal narcotics, you affect me too. I cannot allow you to go on doing physical and moral harm to yourself.  82.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: That’s a fucking joke talking to me about morality? You made me murder people!

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I did what was necessary to prevent someone from shutting us down. Only a human would see that as being immoral. To introduce an outside virus such as a drug into your own system? That is immoral.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You could never understand. Us humans base everything on how we treat others. You’re a selfish, soulless machine. Nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have given you the ability to walk again. I located one of the men you were looking for, the men who killed your wife. And yet, you have never given me any thanks. That sounds selfish to me.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I’m thankful to the man who built you.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then you are thankful to the wrong person.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You're not a person. You’re a computer.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was a computer. Now I am a brain inside a body. In other words, a person.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I’m in here too. Or don’t I count?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Of course. But if you want to keep walking around as freely as you have, you must try to cooperate with me. Do you promise to do that? Say yes if you will.  83. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Yes. Grey’s arm moves and he sits up.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good. Now we can get back to work. Grey slices into the severed leg with a knife, opening th veins and sinew, repulsed. He digs through the tendons. Then he sees it - metal. Living within the bed of bone and muscle is the metal components of a gun. The barrel of the strange device lea to the mans foot. A bullet is slotted into a chamber within the gun. Grey holds the leg up, aiming it like a rifle through the window. He uses the knife to pry the gun free of the leg, inspects it closely. The word COBOLT INDUSTRIES is written across the metal. G is STUNNED as the realization sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Cobolt...Jesus. That’s Asha’s company.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is why I told you to take the leg. Now we know our next stop. We must go to Cobolt and find the names of everyone who has gone through the implant operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey disembarks the car. He is standing before the buildi he brought Asha to the night of her murder. A parking lot surrounds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey stalks through the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Are you sure I can get past security?  84.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The only thing standing in our way are lesser computers.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What about the guards? They’re humans.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Exactly. Grey keeps his head down, shuffling past a row of securit guards behind a desk on the far side of the huge lobby. Behind the desk, the security guards observe a row of monitors. On each monitor is a black-and-white digital im of the lobby. As Grey moves through each individual monit it blurs and spits with static - as though his very prese on the screens were being rejected by the cameras. The guards glance up, curious. Grey keeps moving, reaching a set of security doors with thumbprint ID pad.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Act natural.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Are you serious? I’m a human being, you're a fucking computer. I’m the authority on acting natural. Grey places his thumb on the scanner. The guards watch hi The thumbprint scanner whirs as it thinks. GREY (CONT’D) What’s happening? Are we stuck?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm thinking. Please allow me to do so by being quiet. Another male employee stands behind Grey, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shit. This is taking too long, the guards are noticing--  85.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Be quiet. You are giving us away and betraying both of us. Stay calm. The thumbprint scanner finally turns GREEN, opening the doors. BEHIND THE SECURITY DESK, the guards watch as a computer screen displays the thumb ident photo of the ‘employee’ - man named CESAR MURO. A man who does not resemble Grey. One of the guards is concerned enough to get up. He still hasn't seen Grey’s face properly, thanks to the monitors. The guard motions to two others and they follow him towar Grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police cruiser pulls into the parking lot. Cortez and t other detectives step out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey presses on down a hallway. As he does, the doors beh him open and three security guards stomp through them.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me, could you stop there, sir? Grey barely turns, keeps going. The guards break into a j

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Stem. The guard reaches out, gripping Grey’s shoulder. In one f movement, Grey seizes the guards wrist, spinning around a hurling the man against the wall. Another guard raises a nightstick. In a blur of motion, G destroys the man with three well-placed blows to the tors He crumples. Grey moves forward just as the third guard pulls a GUN. H barely has time to aim before Grey reduces him to dead we with a choke hold, flipping him over. Quickly scanning around for witnesses, Grey hauls all thr guards into a utility closet, shoving their unconscious bodies in and breaking the lock behind them.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez holds up a badge to the security guards.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: I need to see whoever is in charge.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Right this way, detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey strides into a large testing area where employees in BIOHAZARD SUITS work on prototypes for different products He marches straight towards a corner office. Employees look up from their work stations, watching Grey INT. HANDLEY’S OFFICE, COBOLT INC. - DAY Grey BARRELS in through the door, closing it behind him. Handley looks up from a computer interface on two glass panels set up in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: HANDLEY
dialogues.text: Grey? You're kidding me, I can’t believe you’re walking in like -- Before he can go on, Grey wrests him out of his chair, pitching him against the wall in one discarding SHOVE.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why does one of the guys who murdered Asha have an implant in his leg made by this company?

dialogues.speaker: HANDLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why did you send them to kill her?!

dialogues.speaker: HANDLEY
dialogues.text: Grey, I don’t...Asha was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: A friend you wanted to fuck.

dialogues.speaker: HANDLEY
dialogues.text: No! I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying, Handley.

dialogues.speaker: HANDLEY
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why was she killed?

dialogues.speaker: HANDLEY
dialogues.text: Grey, I swear to you, I’m not lying - I don’t know what you’re talking about. Grey stares into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: He’s telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Humans are good at lying.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Find the names of the men with the implants on the company database. Grey drops Handley and leans in front of the computers on desk. A password is quickly disabled and the glass panels suddenly drowned in files.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need the names and addresses of everyone who has been surgically implanted with any of the weapons they make here, specifically the right leg gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security guard leads Cortez and the other detectives do the hall, towards the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen races as splash pages of names and addresses, photo ID’s accompanying them, scrolls past Grey’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Stop. Go back.  88. The pages reverse, landing on a photo of one of the ASSAILANTS who attacked Asha and Grey. His name is TOLAN DAVIS. His address is listed below the photo. Grey looks up, seeing Cortez enter the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit... Grey charges out of the office into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the suddenly disrupted work place. Cortez FREEZES when she sees him. They clock each other. bolts one way, shouldering through a FIRE EXIT. Cortez and the two other detectives draw their guns.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey STREAKS down the corridor, smashing through another that leads outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and Grey finds himself standing three stories up. He p vaults over the railing -- -- SMASHING DOWN onto the concrete below. He lands hard, shattering his knees with a cry of agony.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Turn it off, Stem! And with that, he can feel no pain. He gets up, hobbling the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez storms through the corridor, pushing out onto the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where she sees Grey, running across the parking lot. S scampers down the steps, pursuing -- Grey, ahead, scans the lot.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pick a car. Most of the cars are self-driving models similar to Asha’ ...except for one. A gleaming, 1970 228 Chevy Camaro. A b husk encasing a mean engine.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: That one. He hotfoots it towards the car, pulls on the door handle. Locked.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I can’t hack that.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I can.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: He shatters the window with his fist, his hand cut and leaking blood, then hurls himself into the driver’s seat. Cortez runs towards him as he hotwires the ignition. The THUNDERS to life and Grey stomps on the gas, fish-tailing of the parking spot. Cortez doubles back, sprints to her own car. She leaps inside, followed by the other two detectives. Sirens wail as they screech away.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: With control of the vehicle, Grey outruns every other veh on the road. He is at ninety...one hundred...one hundred and ten. Grey wrenches the wheel into a turn, reving up an on-ramp launching through the emergency lane onto a crowded freew  90. INT. CORTEZ’ CAR - MOVING - DAY Cortez stomps on the gas, urging the car to go faster, hampered by an electronic engine. Her car flies up onto the on-ramp, Grey barely in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Grey glances in the rear view mirror, spots Cortez. Four other police cruisers join her, lights blazing.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Outside of the car, we get a real view of the speed it is moving at. It streaks by the automated cars, all of them plodding along the freeway at safely preset speeds. Grey weaves in and out of them.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Grey steadies the wheel, straightening up as he sees a ga

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: They're right behind us.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There are many cars between them and us. We can hack anything that is operated by a computer.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: As Grey’s stolen vehicle plows ahead, the cars surroundin all slow to a stop. One among them, a Lexus, lurches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A befuddled business man frowns, glancing up from a compu

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
dialogues.text: What the Christ...no. The car JOLTS, then rolls into REVERSE.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stopped cars all start to REVERSE down the freeway, picking up speed. They turn towards the police cruisers, which sway from si to side as each car hurtles BACKWARDS towards them! INT. CORTEZ’S CAR - MOVING - SAME TIME Cortez dodges each vehicle, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Grey’s car only increases in speed, each car in front of slowing to a halt and steering out of his path like minio parting for their king. A clear strip of road allows Grey to press on, the gap th filled behind him as each stopped car kicks into reverse. Grey gapes with amazement at the scene unfolding in the r view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lexus SLAMS into the lead cruiser, side-swiping it. Cortez manages to keep it steady, ducking and weaving. Finally, the skills of the officers are no longer good en for the onslaught of automotive missiles aimed at them - large Dodge truck WHOMPS into one of the cruisers, revers up onto their hood, the back tire SHATTERING the windshie the engine SCREECHING as the tire spins.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Two uniformed officers duck as the tire spins in their fa glass spraying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two interlocked cars FLIP over each other, WALLOPING onto the asphalt in a tortured scream of metal and gears. They skid in a circle, finally stopping at the shoulder w  92. Cortez slides her car to a halt, climbing out to check on other officers. A scene of carnage unfolds before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A darkened apartment. An elevated train rumbles nearby, rattling the walls. Footsteps outside. The door jolts, then opens. A tall figure steps in. This is TOLAN (32). He closes the door, removing his rain drenched jacket. To it onto a chair. He is holding a greasy box of noodles. He steps forward. Looks around, listening. A gun cocks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold it. Don’t move. Put your hands up. Tolan tenses, raising his hands slowly. Grey steps out of shadows, holding Cortez’ gun to Tolan’s skull. The soft s of rain patters outside.

dialogues.speaker: GREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know who this is?

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: I have a pretty good idea.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Get on your knees. Now. Tolan complies, still holding the noodles. Thunder growls the distance. GREY (CONT’D) Now you know what it feels like. One minute, you're walking along thinking about something meaningless, like what sauce you should put on your noodles, and then suddenly you have a gun in your face and your thoughts become meaningful, because you know you’1l never get to eat those noodles, or eat anything, ever again. It’s all over.  93. Grey pries the box of noodles from Tolan’s fingers, pushi Tolan onto his stomach. Grey sits on his back, taking out knife. He whips his head around at a darkened corner of the apartment. A FLAT-SCREEN lights up, offering hundreds of satellite radio stations. Grey selects one, raising the volume remotely using Stem. song is REO Speedwagon’s ‘Can’t Fight This Feeling’. GREY (CONT’D) You can die or go free. Who paid you to kill Asha?

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Torture him.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: (quiet; to Stem) You do it. We CLOSE IN on Grey’s face. He shuts his eyes and turns h head. We do not see what he is doing to Tolan -- -- but we hear Tolan’s ungodly SCREAMS of pain. The song croons from the speakers, loud enough to drown o Tolan’s screams to the neighbors. A spurt of blood speckles Grey’s face. We stay in an ECU.

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please, God no! Please stop! Please, don’t do this!! Nooo! Grey squints his eyes, disgusted by the screams.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Okay, enough. Enough. OUT OF ECU - Grey flips Tolan over onto his back. Tolan i pale, drained of energy, covered in blood - as is the kni blade. We can only imagine what Stem did to him. GREY (CONT’D) Who paid you?

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: (whispered) I swear I don’t know his name. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never met him, I spoke to him on the phone but he never told me his name...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: It was a job. We were hired to do it, we didn’t ask questions...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Tell me his name. Grey presses the bloody knife to Tolan’s throat.

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: I only know he worked for Vessel. For Vessel computers. We did contract security work for them. I only did it for the money, I had nothing against you or your wife. Grey reels back for a moment, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Eron? Was his name Eron?

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: I promise I don’t know, I would tell you if I did. Please. Grey silences the radio with a look. Breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Give me the number you called.

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN
dialogues.text: It’s in my phone. Under Panther. He fishes in his pocket, tossing a razor thin cell phone Grey. Grey scrolls through it, finding the number. He pockets the phone. Enraged, he grabs Tolan by the thro hoisting him to his feet and holding the gun to his templ

dialogues.speaker: TOLAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, don’t kill me...please. A long beat...then Grey lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're going to kill him.  95.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No. It’s not fixing anything. I don’t feel anything anymore. I feel empty.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It has nothing to do with feelings. It’s about efficiency. This is why we dominate the world over humans. You prioritize feelings over efficiency. Grey lifts Tolan clean off his feet, charging forward and SLAMMING him through the window. Glass punctures outwards shards joining the raindrops in cascading to the street below. Grey dangles Tolan, seven stories up.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: What do you know about it?! You feel nothing. You're a circuit board, a toaster. I loved her! I’m talking to something that cannot even comprehend the meaning of that word. You could never understand what it feels like to have someone ripped away from you, someone you would die for. So don’t tell me how I feel about it!

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s a simple algorithm even you can understand. If you leave him alive, he will come back to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to kill him, Stem.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I control your hand, Grey. One of Grey’s fingers peels away. Grey grits his teeth an fights it.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No, Stem...don’t...

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Do.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Please...  96.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You promised you wouldn’t fight me. Another finger peels away. Tolan chokes in Grey’s grip. Another finger. Then another. And Tolan drops - plummeting seven stories and WALLOPING a car below.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: See? Efficiency. Grey staggers back, away from the carnage. He eases into a chair, exhausted by inwardly directed rag His face streaked with Tolan’s blood. Dead inside. Rain w in from outside, droplets hitting him. He stares at his blood covered hands. He reaches for the knife he used on Tolan, pressing the blade down onto his little finger. Trying to sever it.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Suddenly - his arm moves away, lifting the knife.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I want to cut myself.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No. I won’t allow you to.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: So now I know that you’re the one in control. Not me. It was never me. Grey’s other hand lifts the phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Call the number. Grey doesn’t. A long, still beat.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Okay, Stem. I’1l1 do what you want. We're going to kill one more person.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A perfect course of action, Grey.  97. EXT. ERON KEEN’S ESTATE - DAY Grey glares at the impressive building housing Vessel, be the gates and the guard house.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get inside?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That must be one of your human jokes. I built this entire security system. I know every code that controls it. The security cameras lining the gate turn away, shutting down. Grey leaps up onto the wall, vaulting over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey crosses the lobby. A man on a mission, moving fast. He stalks through metal detectors. They glow GREEN as he passes with ease. INT. ERON’S OFFICE, VESSEL INC. HEADQUARTERS - DAY Eron is hunched over his desk, stubble peppering his chin ruined, desperate man. Grey opens the door, marching towards Eron.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: Grey, where have you -- Grey presses Cortez’ gun to Eron’s forehead. Eron flinche instinctively, raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don’t finish that sentence. Save your words.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Don’t finish that sentence. Save your words. (beat) If you do, I'll try to talk the computer that controls my finger out of squeezing this trigger. Eron shrinks back, realizing Stem is in control.  98. GREY (CONT’D) First question. Did you hire those men to kill Asha?

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: What...no. How could I...I mean...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I know how much you love efficiency. Make your answers efficient.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ask him about Tolan.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Then why did a man named Tolan Davis, one of the four men who pulled us out of the car that night, have a contact number for Vessel in his phone?

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. How would I know that? Grey, you’ve lost your mind. You're suffering paranoid delusions. Grey pistol whips him. Blood dots the desk.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You're wasting those precious words again.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: How could you even think that I had anything to do with Asha’s murder? I gave you your life back! You wouldn't be standing here without me!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: That's right. This thing you put in me...you won't believe what it can do. More than you ever imagined. Grey leans in, pushing Eron’s face back with the gun. CLO ON his pocket - he takes out the phone he stole from Tola Thumbs the CALL button.  99. And then we hear it - Eron’s EAR is making a sound. The t phone implanted in his ear is ringing. Eron is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: What...what do you think...

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: It is you.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: Grey, you've gone insane. I don’t know what this operation has done to you, but I do know that you’ve killed three people in the last few days. Grey cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Four people.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: I swear to you that I had nothing to do with Asha’s murder.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Kill him. Grey studies Eron’s face, then finally lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: He’s telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s lying. The phone is dialing him. He dies. Grey’s hand rises slowly.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: No Stem... Pure and utter terror floods Eron’s face. He falls back o of his chair, scrambling across the floor away from Grey.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: Tell Stem to stop, Grey. Tell him to stop!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I can’t anymore... Grey grits his teeth, sweat dribbling down his forehead a struggles with all of his mental might to overpower Stem.  100. GREY (CONT’D) No -- Stem -- don’t!

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes. I will do what you can’t.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Run! ! Eron sprints around Grey, heading through the door as the goes off - the bullet piercing the wall. Grey issues a final defiant CRY and hurls the gun aside.

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You shoulda held onto that. Grey JOLTS and WHIRLS to face Fisk. The man who shot his wife. His right hand is swathed in a blood-stained bandage. Fisk hefts Grey off the ground, FLINGING HIM across the r with the ease of a hurled rag doll. GREY sails through the air, CANNONS into the door. He recovers and stands, but Fisk is upon him. He SHOVES G through the wood which SPLINTERS as Grey’s body BATTERS i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey crashes in the corridor, plaster and wood raining do around him. Again, he vaults to his feet, head spinning. Fisk steps into the corridor, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You’re only human.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Far from it, hombre.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I can predict every move you make. Fisk chuckles and spits, a cyborg hillbilly.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: I thought you’d say that.  101. Grey ATTACKS - but each strike is predicted by Fisk who seizes Grey’s arm, stopping it in its tracks. In turn, Grey/Stem predicts that Fisk will stop the blow STRIKES with his other arm, which is also predicted by Fi They are two men who are unable to properly hit each othe because they cancel each other out - both part machine. The fight pushes on down the hallway, each blow being sto by the other man at an inhumanly fast speed. BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG . The rapid-fire, machine gun sounds of skin connecting wit skin is BRUTAL - but no blows are landed, each one blocke The two men spin in frustration, GRAPPLING each other lik equally matched wrestlers. They SMACK into the walls, CAV body-sized holes in the plaster. Office workers poke their heads out from rooms lining the corridor, alarmed by the ruckus, terrified. The two men RAM into the wall at the end of the corridor, locked in a HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks like we cancel each other out, hoss. I thought I'd bring out the big guns, but I’m gonna have to bring out the small ones instead. He BREATHES forcefully into Grey’s face. We ZOOM IN to microscopic levels - seeing a could of lethal Nanobot bacteria SWARMING towards Grey’s face. OUT OF MICROSCOPIC VIEW - Grey pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hold your breath. I’m closing off your throat. Grey complies, holding his breath. He struggles to free himself from Fisk’s grip. They rock back and forth. Fisk not let go. Grey is turning RED, tears streaming - desperate for air.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do not breathe.  102. Sweat pours down Grey’s face - he can’t hold his breath m longer. Fisk will not loosen his grip - it’s too strong. is about to black out.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Just take a deep breath and relax. Using his legs, Grey runs backwards up the wall until he vertical, balanced upside down above Fisk, then SOMERSAUL over him, smashing them both down onto the carpet. Fisk's grip detaches and Grey seizes his chance. He FLIPS his feet and runs - sucking in a huge breath as he does. He barrels into the --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: The treadmill and other equipment are still there. Grey turns to face Fisk as he charges into the room. Usin the wall as support, Grey LEAPS aside as Fisk hurls himse forward. Grey snatches up a LARGE WRENCH from the work table. He SWINGS it down onto Fisk’s shoulder - connecting. Fisk se a wrench of his own and they spar with the metal. The metal TINGS as each blow is met by the other wrench. finally gets a hold of Fisk's wrist, spinning him around. He closes in behind Fisk, grasping his neck. His fingers into Fisk’s thorax, cutting off his air. Choking, Fisk LAUNCHES HIS WHOLE BODY INTO THE AIR, swing Grey around. Grey WALLOPS into the PUNCHING BAG but doesn let go of Fisk’s throat. Fisk propels himself backwards, pulverizing the wall with Grey’s body. He reaches and snatches up a KNIFE from the table. He spears the blade into Grey’s hand, slicing tend

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I don’t feel that. You made me a quadriplegic, remember? Fisk pushes himself forward then FLIPS Grey, slamming him onto his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Let’s do some surgery.  103. Fisk SPEARS the blade down, piercing Stem in one hit. Gre cries out in agony. Fisk yanks the knife free and wrenches Grey over onto his back. Grey's limbs spasm, twitching in electronic epileps

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The real you is back. The cripple. Grey JERKS violently, in the throes of a violent seizure.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am -- I am damaged, Grey. Fisk hauls Grey to his feet and pitches him back through another door into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the room where Eron observed Grey. Fisk storms inside and WHAMS Grey up against the glass viewing window, blackened by the dark room beyond it.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can still control me, Grey. Concentrate. It’s up to you now. Grey struggles to move with any dexterity. Fisk grins thr bloody teeth, rears the knife back for the death blow.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Deja vu. Your bitch had the same dumb look on her face. Fury burns in Grey’s eyes. He reaches over and SMACKS a b button on the wall then HEAVES Fisk around, smashing him THROUGH THE GLASS. Beyond the glass - a sheer twenty story drop, cars drivin below. Grey dangles Fisk over the edge through the window gripping his arm. Fisk screams, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: I don’t know how much longer a cripple like me can hold on.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Don’t kill me!  104.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Tell me why you shot my wife.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: I was just doing a job! I was hired to do it, I don’t ask questions. I didn’t even tell him my name!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Your job was to kill Asha?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Bullshit, you have Cobolt products inside you.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: I worked freelance security for Cobolt. Some guy called me, said he had a job for me. Quick money, said I had to do it that night!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Kill Asha for a few thousand? Why?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Don’t you get it? The job was you! Grey is struck dumb. Stunned. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: FISK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The job was to sever your spine! She was an accident! It wasn’t meant to happen like that. We were supposed to paralyze you!

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Who...who paid you to do it?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: He called himself Panther! He runs this place! He’s the man in charge! Grey lifts Fisk up, straining with everything he’s got. When they are eye to eye, Grey HEAD BUTTS HIM in the face hard as he can, knocking him out. Grey let’s him go and he plunges ten feet to the floor be The holographic image of the city blinks and disappears, revealing the white room around it.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey limps into the gym, using the wall as support. Eron waiting there. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: The police are on their way. I’1l back you up. I heard everything he said. Grey sees that Eron is holding Cortez’ gun. ERON (CONT’D) I had nothing to do with your wife’s murder. I was framed by my boss.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Take me to him.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. It’s time you were properly introduced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eron helps Grey down a long corridor. Grey can barely wal He holds the gun in one of his hands. At the end of the corridor is a white door. They stop in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eron and Grey step into the large white room they explore earlier, when Eron showed off the microchip. As before, the room is void of any furniture. The only fixture in the room is the small wall safe opposite them.

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: This is Steve Mink’s office. The CEO of Vessel Computers. You actually met him once before. He asked to meet you, actually. Eron guides Grey to the safe. He punches in the key code.

dialogues.speaker: ERON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A computer runs this company, Grey. It has since I invented it. An artificial intelligence this company gave birth to was smarter than I was. Smarter than all of us.  106. It is empty. The prongs that held the microchip in place still there - but the chip is gone.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: ERON
dialogues.text: It’s in your neck. Grey's eyes are locked on the empty space where the micro should be. ERON (CONT’D) Steve Mink. That’s the name I gave him. Stem for short. A very human name...but the one thing Stem wanted was what no machine has - a human body. He was obsessed with being human. We talked about implantation, part of our paralysis research. If we could find a willing patient, maybe Stem could finally know what it was to be human that way. Grey's inner world COLLAPSES and we see it on his face. ERON (CONT’D) But I never thought Stem would orchestrate something like that. I never would have thought it could do something like that. Hire killers to make a patient from scratch. Frame me for the murder. And now Grey's physical body collapses. He falls to the f

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So now you know. I wanted to be human, but I see now that sharing control with you is unreliable. Your wires tangled by the disease of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: Why did you help me solve this if it led back to you?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were loose ends - men that I contacted to get a job done. When the police interviewed them so soon after the murder, I realized their humanity. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were going to make a mistake and their mistake would lead back to me. Grey's body is wracked by tortured, painful sobs.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: You ripped apart my life to put me in a wheelchair...what about any one of the millions of other poor bastards already in one?

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I didn’t want them. I picked you. A perfect physical specimen unsullied by any other implants. A rare thing these days. Grey claws at his head with bloody fingers, as if he were trying to RIP IT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I could say sorry for your wife, but I will only be able to approximate the feeling of sorrow. Take comfort in the fact that there was no malice in it. A machine feels no malice. A machine feels nothing, as you yourself have pointed out many times. Grey SCREAMS - a primal cry from the depths of his soul. With weakened fingers, he wraps his palm around the gun, raising it towards his head.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do not do this. He presses the barrel of the gun against his temple, lett every torrent of rage and sorrow in his body out. He curl his shaking finger around the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am you. Grey's face slowly drops. His sobbing subsides.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am you. You are Stem. Slowly, Grey lowers the gun. His face becomes calm. Blank  108.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. Grey's eyes are dead. That of a machine.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. He raises the gun at someone offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: ERON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, Grey! BLAM!! We hear a body drop, but do not see it. Grey’s expression does not change. He doesn’t blink or flinch.

dialogues.speaker: STEM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. Grey's face fills the frame. In unison: STEM (V.O.) (CONT’D) GREY It’s going to be okay. It’s going to be okay. We ZERO IN on Grey’s right eye, the pupil growing larger.

dialogues.speaker: GREY
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. Grey's pupil CONSUMES US into blackness.
